item.title: XMLRPC npm Library Turns Malicious, Steals Data, Deploys Crypto Miner
item.description:

item.title: Russia Passes Bill Taxing Crypto Transactions, Exempts Miners from VAT
item.description:
Russia's Federation Council has approved a tax bill recognizing cryptocurrencies as property, imposing a 13%-15% tax on transactions while exempting miners from VAT, pending President Putin's signature to become law.

The post Russia Passes Bill Taxing Crypto Transactions, Exempts Miners from VAT appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: [$] GIMP 3.0 — a milestone for open-source image editing
item.description: The long-awaited release of the GNU Image Manipulation Program (GIMP) 3.0 is on the way, marking the first major update since version 2.10 was released in April 2018. It now features a GTK 3 user interface and GIMP 3.0 introduces significant changes to the core platform and plugins. This release also brings performance and usability improvements, as well as more compatibility with Wayland and complex input sources.

item.title: Security updates for US Thanksgiving (Thursday)
item.description: Security updates have been issued by Debian (firefox-esr, netatalk, and thunderbird), Fedora (firefox, libsoup3, mingw-glib2, mingw-libsoup, mingw-python-waitress, mingw-python3, nss, perl-Module-ScanDeps, php, and python-aiohttp), Mageia (dcmtk, golang, iptraf-ng, libsndfile, microcode, php, postgresql15 & postgresql13, rapidjson, tomcat, wget, and zbar), Red Hat (openssl and openssl-fips-provider, toolbox, and webkit2gtk3), SUSE (firefox, frr, glib2, hplip, kernel, neomutt-20241114, ovmf, python-aiohttp, python-virtualenv, python310-tornado6, qemu, webkit2gtk3, and xen), and Ubuntu (mpg123 and vim).
